course.title: Principles of Drug Discovery and Development
course.faculty_text: Gregory L. Verdine and Vicki L. Sato
course.description: This interdisciplinary course will examine the process of drug discovery and development through disease-driven examples. Topics include: the efficacy/toxicity balance, the differences between drugs and inhibitors, and the translation of cellular biochemistry to useful medicine.
course.prerequisites: Chemistry 20/30 or 17/27, Life Sciences 52 or their equivalents, MCB 52, and one year of organic chemistry. MCB 54 is recommended.
course.notes: May not be taken concurrently with Chemistry 192. May not be taken for credit if Chemistry 192 or MCB 192 have already been taken.
